page.title: 17ELLAND POWER STATION
page.content: Elland power station is situated one mile to the east of Elland on the south bank of the River Calder, adjacent to the main Manchester to Wakefield railway line. The station occupies a site of some 65 acres. It was designed and built by the,then Central Elec. Generating Board Northern Project Group. Construction began August 1954 The station first supplied elect.to the grid 6 June 1959. It officially opened 28 Ap@ril 196l. Coal supplies from Yorkshire coalfields can be delivered to the station two ways, rail or road, after unloading it can be distributed to coal bunker or coal stock by conveyor system. Cooling water for the condensers is from the R.Calder and returned there of fed through the cooling tower system.
